name: Debloated Greentube
description: a minimalistic green version of youtube color-switching ISN'T FINISHED YET
additional_info: This is a mashup of my debloated version of youtube (see: https://userstyles.org/styles/109262/hideyt) and a color-scheme, since my old one depended on the user having black youtube. there are some issues that im trying to fix still, but here is the first release *24/2/2015 ver 1.01. Haven't had much time to work on this style, but tweaked some minor issues i had with it. filled in some colors and added the "Add to" button. also been noticing many users who download this uses CHROME... im sorry if it doesn't fully function since i develop it on FX without the intention of chrome-compability. i will not solve issues that chrome-users may have. 12/3/2015 ver 1.02 *color updates *no black background 17/3/2015 some updates have been made on the website and i had to change some stuff. basically it boils down to the comment section. i've tried to fix it as best as i can for now but will probably redo the changes once i have more time. 23/3/2015 fixed some buttons growing white and i also added the option to have the one-punch man(manga) as a logo instead of youtube's logo. just de-comment (remove the "*/" and "/*") the #logo values in the top of the css-code. 24/4/2015 hey guys! I've been having lots of shit to do in my university but took the time to learn a bit about advanced selectors. This has taught me how to get rid of those pesky and annoying recommendations on the front page. This might be a bit buggy tho since the algorithm depends on that ads are showing in the exact same order in the main feed (i.e it might hide some stuff that's wrong, but it seems like 8/10 it hides "recommended"). this function is only present for those who has an account on youtube. 26/4/2015 Added mascots in the guide-sidebar. i've been thinking about making different color-schemes soon. 10/7/2015 Going back to a stable build (one i use myself) til i fix all the bugs.
